Are you suppose to turn that on when compiling both the test src and the
code src or just the test src?

	-----Original Message-----
	From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...] 
	Sent: Wednesday, June 05, 2002 6:57 AM
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	Subject: Re: [junit] Unknown Source?
	
	
	Guerry Semones wrote:
	
	>I've used Junit in past jobs, and do not recall seeing this
issue.  I am
	>running Junit under JDK1.31 on Windows and a Unix platform.  In
either
	>case, when I get a failure's stack trace, I get "unknown
source" for my
	>java code, rather than a line number where one would expect it.
	>
	
	Make sure the Java compiler is being invoked with debug enabled
(-g).  
	
	If you're using Ant, the javac task should include
	
	    debug="true"
	
	
	Let me know if this helps, and I'll add it to the FAQ.
	
	Mike
